DataElement.preferredName: Bronchiolitis Obliterans National Institutes of Health Diagnostic Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Grouping to describe how a diagnosis of Bronchiolitis Obliterans (BO) was made at the National Institutes of Health (NIH).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bronchiolitis Obliterans Disease National Institutes of Health Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of bronchiolitis obliterans, an inflammation of the bronchioles with obstruction by fibrous granulation tissue or bronchial exudate, that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person._An agency of the PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE concerned with the overall planning, promoting, and administering of programs pertaining to health and medical research._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the bronchioles with obstruction by fibrous granulation tissue or bronchial exudate. It may follow inhalation of irritating gases or foreign bodies and it complicates pneumonia.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the bronchioles with obstruction by fibrous granulation tissue or bronchial exudate. It may follow inhalation of irritating gases or foreign bodies and it complicates pneumonia.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: An agency of the PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE concerned with the overall planning, promoting, and administering of programs pertaining to health and medical research.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: A federal agency in the U.S. that conducts biomedical research in its own laboratories; supports the research of non-Federal scientists in universities, medical schools, hospitals, and research institutions throughout the country and abroad; helps in the training of research investigators; and fosters communication of medical information. Access the National Institutes of Health Web site at http://www.nih.gov.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Residual Volume to Total Lung Capacity Ratio is Greater Than 120%

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Residual Volume to Total Lung Capacity Ratio is Greater Than 120%
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::120: The total volume of air in the lungs after maximum inhalation.: The volume of air remaining in the lungs at the end of a maximal expiration. Common abbreviation is RV.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The total volume of air in the lungs after maximum inhalation.
The volume of air remaining in the lungs at the end of a maximal expiration. Common abbreviation is RV.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::120: The volume of air remaining in the lungs at the end of a maximal expiration. Common abbreviation is RV.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The volume of air remaining in the lungs at the end of a maximal expiration. Common abbreviation is RV.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second to Slow Vital Capacity Ratio is Less Than 0.7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second to Slow Vital Capacity Ratio is Less Than 0.7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0.7: A test of lung function, the FEV1 is the volume exhaled during the first second of a forced expiratory maneuver started from the level of total lung capacity. It is the most frequently used index for assessing bronchoconstriction or bronchodilatation.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

A test of lung function, the FEV1 is the volume exhaled during the first second of a forced expiratory maneuver started from the level of total lung capacity. It is the most frequently used index for assessing bronchoconstriction or bronchodilatation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.
